verses.kjv: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.ct: After these events, during the reign of King Artaxerxes of Persia, Ezra — a descendant of Seraiah, who was the son of Azariah, who was the son of Hilkiah,

verses.kjv: The son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
verses.ct: who was the son of Shallum, who was the son of Zadok, who was the son of Ahitub,

verses.kjv: The son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
verses.ct: who was the son of Amariah, who was the son of Azariah, who was the son of Meraioth,

verses.kjv: The son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
verses.ct: who was the son of Zerahiah, who was the son of Uzzi, who was the son of Bukki,

verses.kjv: The son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest:
verses.ct: who was the son of Abishua, who was the son of Phinehas, who was the son of Eleazar, who was the son of Aaron the chief priest —

verses.kjv: This Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which the LORD God of Israel had given: and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him.
verses.ct: this Ezra traveled up from Babylon. He was an expert scribe in the law of Moses, which the LORD God of Israel had given. The king gave him everything he asked for, because the LORD his God was with him.

verses.kjv: And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinims, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
verses.ct: Some of the Israelites, along with priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, and temple servants, also traveled to Jerusalem in the 7th year of King Artaxerxes.

verses.kjv: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
verses.ct: Ezra arrived in Jerusalem in the 5th month of the king's 7th year.

verses.kjv: For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
verses.ct: He had departed from Babylon on the 1st day of the 1st month, and he reached Jerusalem on the 1st day of the 5th month, because the gracious hand of his God was guiding him.

verses.kjv: For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and judgments.
verses.ct: Ezra had devoted himself to studying the law of the LORD, to practicing it, and to teaching its rules and regulations throughout Israel.

verses.kjv: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, even a scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of his statutes to Israel.
verses.ct: Here is a copy of the letter that King Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest and scribe, a scholar of the commandments and statutes that the LORD gave to Israel:

verses.kjv: Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, a scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect peace, and at such a time.
verses.ct: "From Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, a scholar of the law of the God of heaven: Greetings.

verses.kjv: I make a decree, that all they of the people of Israel, and of his priests and Levites, in my realm, which are minded of their own freewill to go up to Jerusalem, go with thee.
verses.ct: I am issuing a decree that any of the people of Israel in my kingdom — including their priests and Levites — who voluntarily choose to go to Jerusalem may travel with you.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as thou art sent of the king, and of his seven counsellors, to enquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which is in thine hand;
verses.ct: You are being sent by the king and his 7 advisors to investigate conditions in Judah and Jerusalem based on the law of your God, which you carry with you.

verses.kjv: And to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellors have freely offered unto the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
verses.ct: You are also to bring the silver and gold that the king and his advisors have voluntarily given to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem,

verses.kjv: And all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem:
verses.ct: along with all the silver and gold you can collect throughout the province of Babylon, including the voluntary contributions from the people and the priests for the house of their God in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: That thou mayest buy speedily with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meat offerings and their drink offerings, and offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: With this money, you must promptly purchase bulls, rams, and lambs, along with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and present them on the altar of the house of your God in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do after the will of your God.
verses.ct: Whatever you and your brothers decide to do with the remaining silver and gold, do as your God directs.

verses.kjv: The vessels also that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God, those deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The vessels that have been given to you for the service of the house of your God — deliver those to the God of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king’s treasure house.
verses.ct: If anything else is needed for the house of your God that you find necessary to provide, you may draw from the royal treasury to cover it.

verses.kjv: And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers which are beyond the river, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done speedily,
verses.ct: I, King Artaxerxes, also issue a decree to all the treasurers in the province west of the Euphrates River: whatever Ezra the priest, the scholar of the law of the God of heaven, requests from you must be provided promptly,

verses.kjv: Unto an hundred talents of silver, and to an hundred measures of wheat, and to an hundred baths of wine, and to an hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.
verses.ct: up to 100 talents of silver, 100 measures of wheat, 100 baths of wine, 100 baths of oil, and unlimited salt.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
verses.ct: Whatever the God of heaven requires must be carried out carefully for the house of the God of heaven. Why would we risk bringing his anger down on the kingdom of the king and his sons?

verses.kjv: Also we certify you, that touching any of the priests and Levites, singers, porters, Nethinims, or ministers of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose toll, tribute, or custom, upon them.
verses.ct: We also inform you that no taxes, tribute, or duties may be imposed on any of the priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, temple servants, or other workers in this house of God.

verses.kjv: And thou, Ezra, after the wisdom of thy God, that is in thine hand, set magistrates and judges, which may judge all the people that are beyond the river, all such as know the laws of thy God; and teach ye them that know them not.
verses.ct: And you, Ezra, using the wisdom your God has given you, appoint officials and judges to administer justice for all the people in the province west of the Euphrates River — everyone who knows the laws of your God. Those who don't know them, you must teach.

verses.kjv: And whosoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed speedily upon him, whether it be unto death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
verses.ct: Anyone who refuses to obey the law of your God and the law of the king must be punished swiftly, whether by death, exile, seizure of property, or imprisonment."

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers, which hath put such a thing as this in the king’s heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem:
verses.ct: Praise the LORD, the God of our ancestors, who put it in the king's heart to honor the house of the LORD in Jerusalem like this!

verses.kjv: And hath extended mercy unto me before the king, and his counsellors, and before all the king’s mighty princes. And I was strengthened as the hand of the LORD my God was upon me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.
verses.ct: He showed me mercy in the presence of the king, his advisors, and all the king's powerful officials. Because the hand of the LORD my God was on me, I was strengthened, and I gathered leading men from Israel to go up with me.
